description.narrative: The facility will allow for: Testing of innovations, enabling of rapid delivery, allowing of direct linkage to CO’s CPD, Local resource mobilization application to the CO’s & recognition of accountability at CO and acceleration of implementation of SDGs

condition.narrative: UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: 1.1 Number of new data sources used at Country Office level. 1.2 Diversity of different data sources used 1.3 Number of sustainable development solutions identified and documented 1.4 Variety of innovation methods used to test and iterate over the different hypothesis 2.1 Learning the Accelerator Lab Network shares with a public audience (outside of UNDP) 2.2 Number of lab insights, processes or products which are taken up by governments or other partners 2.3 Proportion of partners and governments that increase their take up of the innovation methods included in the Accelerator Lab Network suite 2.4 Proportion of UNDP Country Office programming influenced by the Accelerator Lab Network’s work and methodologies 3.1 Size and density of the network effects among the Accelerator Labs 3.2 Number of new models, approaches, and insights documented and disseminated throughout the network. 3.3 Engagement of the broader Development ecosystem with published learnings from the Accelerator Lab Network. 3.4 Amount of influence the learnings and methods of the Accelerator Lab Network have on the discourse of the broader Development ecosystem.

comment.narrative: 2 new sources of data per lab 3 different data sources per Lab. 20 new potential solutions per lab 2 new solutions per portfolio 180 blogs, videos, or other (substantial) media posts. 15 lab insights, processes or products which are taken up by governments or other partners 5% partners and governments that increase their take up of the innovation methods included in the Accelerator Lab Network suite 10% Proportion of UNDP Country Office programming influenced by the Accelerator Lab Network’s work and methodologies Each lab should interact at least once a week with another lab, a partner, and the global team. 5% of information shared across the network should be methodology, or sustainable development issue and opportunity related 5% monthly increase in engagement on Twitter. 5% monthly increase in Twitter and LinkedIn followers. 200,000+ impressions on Twitter. 2,000 views per month for blogs. 1% of the conversation will be influenced by the Accelerator Lab Network.

2020 was also a year where a global pandemic upended everything. All the plans which were set out had to transition into COVID-19 related activities and interventions. However, the following were general achievements of the AccLab Namibia: 1. Sense-making workshop -2: Virtual Sense-making with Entrepreneurs and Experience Tour 8ste Laan. 3: 2 Hackathons on improving service delivery and serving the needs of the informal economy; 6 blogs posts done due to absence of dedicated Comms Person for AccLab at UNDP and 1 Podcast.

5 new sources of data per lab 6 different data sources per Lab. 35 new potential solutions per lab 5 new solutions per portfolio 360 blogs, videos, or other (substantial) media posts. 25 lab insights, processes or products which are taken up by governments or other partners 15% partners and governments that increase their take up of the innovation methods included in the Accelerator Lab Network suite 15% Proportion of UNDP Country Office programming influenced by the Accelerator Lab Network’s work and methodologies Each lab should interact at least once a week with another lab, a partner, and the global team. 25% of information shared across the network should be methodology, or sustainable development issue and opportunity related 1.5% monthly rate of engagement on Twitter. 15% increase in Twitter and LinkedIn followers. 200,000+ impressions on Twitter per month. 2,000 views per month for blogs. 10,000 views on LinkedIn. 500 link clicks on LinkedIn. 2.5% of the conversation will be influenced by the Accelerator Lab Network.

5 new sources of data per lab: 1. Integrity committee Whatsapp group / 2. Web scraping of MHAISS charter feedback / 3. Tambula users registration 4. SDG Hub and 5. Innovation Champions Whatsapp Platform / Namibian Moonshots on Facebook (Target reached)
6 Different data sources: 1. Whataspp Integrity Champions / 2. Youth Voices / 3.Digital Integration Report (MHAISS) / 4. Informal Economy Study / 5. SDG Hub / 6. Social media - facebook Namibian Moonshots (citizen Insights) / 7. Public Sector Innovation Champions
35 potential new solutions / 5 per portfolio: as below, our work is mostly concentrated in the GRICE portfolio with some support to the CO
GRICE 1. Whatsapp group for ICs and Innovation Champs 2. Sentiment analysis for ICs 3. Piloting of e-Forms ICs 4. Communication strengthened using BI for Integrity Champions and 5. Sensemaking workshop for Integrity Committees 6. Systems integration report for MHAISS 7. Living Lab – Community engagement and asset mapping 8. Youth Lab – Ethnographic intervews 9. Urban Garden / Aquaponics at Groot Aub (with HSF) 10. Launch Namibia 11. Tambula 12. Puy Local Grow Local 13. Kick COVID our of Namibia FLON campaign 14. NISO Informal Economy Study 15. NAMSTARTER scaling 16. CylonPay experiment for the informal sector (payment gateway) 17. Human Library 18. My Namibia My Country My Pride engagement with MICT 19. Support to the MHAISS on charter implementation and feedback 20. Support to OPM on Innovation Bootcamp 21. Prototyping Innovation Bootcamp OP 22. Prototyping Innovation Bootcamp MHAISS 23. Protoyping the PS Innovation toolkit 24. Piloting the Copenhagen Innovation Barometer 25. Piloting the Innovation Bootcamps and Tool-Box 26. SDG Hub 27. SDG Chatbot 28. Full accredited training module from UNDESA’s Ethics Unit for piloting to the ICs 29. TNA for Innovation Champions (Gov Lab) 30. Conversations that matter (for retired Public Servants) – a failed experiment 31. CylonPay (WIP) 32. Profood (WIP) 33. Urban Agriculture App analysis (WIP) 34. e-passport 35. e-Ticketing 36. Imago device (for MHIASS – WIP)
Addressing the culture and capabilities of the CO: 1. e-Voting for the new Staff Association 2. Staff Engagement survey 3. Slow return to office survey 4. YoUNDP for Beginners
25 Lab Insights taken up by partners 360 social media posts (facebook, twitter and instagram). 25 lab insights, processes or products which are taken up by governments or other partners 15% partners and governments that increase their take up of the innovation methods included in the Accelerator Lab Network suite - Public Sector Innovation toolkit / Tambula 15% Proportion of UNDP Country Office programming influenced by the Accelerator Lab Network’s work and methodologies (YoUNDP for Beginners / Voting on Staff Association / Sensemaking by CO, Language of Lab integrated and used in Strategic documents and portfolios ) The lab has interacted at least once a week with another lab, a partner, and the global team. Due to challenges in recruitment, the lab will only be fully operational in 2020, where all three roles will be filled. Hence, the lab will only be fully operational in 2020.
